title: ‘Bye Bridget’: Somerville bakery claps back at internet ‘troll’ with a line of merch
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Hearth & Hug Bakery in Somerville launched 'Bye Bridget' merchandise after an internet troll criticized their charity donations.
The bakery donates a portion of sales to charity, including recent proceeds to the White Bear Area Food Shelf in Minnesota.
Owner Natalie Hug aims to counter online negativity and promote charitable efforts despite criticism from social media users.

title: ‘Keep their light on in our world’: Daughter remembers Eastham couple who fell through ice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jerry and Kit Boucher, aged 72 and 71, died after falling through ice at Bee's River in Eastham on February 14.
Their daughter, Katy Boucher, has called for acts of kindness in their memory, highlighting their community involvement.
A memorial service for Jerry and Kit Boucher will be held at St. Joan of Arc Church on February 27-28.

title: 3 fires being investigated as arson in Fitchburg, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Fires in three Fitchburg homes within days are under investigation as arson, State Fire Marshal Jon Davine confirmed.
Two suspicious fires occurred on Feb. 14 and 15 at an apartment building with entrances on Blossom and Day streets.
A third fire on Myrtle Avenue injured one person and displaced seven, but it is not believed to be connected.

title: Eric Dane, ‘Grey’s Anatomy’ star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Eric Dane, actor known for 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria,' died at 53 from ALS, less than a year post-diagnosis.
Dane, who passed with his family by his side, became an advocate for ALS awareness and research during his illness.
Dane's memoir 'Book of Days: A Memoir in Moments' will be published in late 2026 by Maria Shriver’s The Open Field.

title: 4 Mass. State Police troopers charged in death of recruit suspended with pay
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Four Mass. State Police troopers charged in recruit death were suspended with pay after duty status hearings.
Lt. Jennifer Penton among those charged; also faces perjury for allegedly lying about recruit's symptoms' knowledge.
Recruit Enrique Delgado-Garcia died from accidental blunt-force head injuries during training in September 2024.

title: Braintree police warn public about planned ‘takeover’ at South Shore Plaza
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Braintree police are preparing for a planned 'takeover' event at South Shore Plaza, scheduled for Friday evening at 7 p.m.
The takeover event was promoted on social media, leading to concerns about large, unpredictable crowds at the shopping mall.
Similar events last fall involved street blockages and drag racing; police are coordinating with partners to ensure safety.

title: Kendrick Perkins has Celtics as ‘dark horse’ to win title in 2026 — under 1 condition
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kendrick Perkins sees the Celtics as title contenders if Jayson Tatum returns from his Achilles injury at 75%.
Despite losing several key players, the Celtics are second in the Eastern Conference with a 35-19 record.
Perkins praises Jaylen Brown as a top MVP contender for his two-way performance, both in scoring and defense.

title: What would it take for the Patriots to land AJ Brown? ESPN analyst cooked up a hypothetical trade.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots consider acquiring Eagles receiver AJ Brown, who's frequently been mentioned as a trade candidate.
ESPN analyst proposes Patriots trade 2026 first, third, and sixth-round picks for AJ Brown and a 2026 second-round pick.
AJ Brown, 28, is under contract through 2029 and would bring needed strength to Patriots' receiving corps.

title: Why Kyle Pitts could be the Patriots’ top free-agent target
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kyle Pitts caught 88 passes for 928 yards and 5 touchdowns for Atlanta in the 2025 NFL season.
Patriots seek to enhance offense and may consider Pitts as a top free-agent option for quarterback Drake Maye.
Pitts could offer Patriots a cost-effective alternative to high-priced wideouts with a projected cap hit of $17.5 million.

title: Provincetown man pleads guilty to possessing, distributing thousands of child porn files
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Laurence Pagnoni, 65, from Provincetown, pleaded guilty in federal court to child pornography possession and distribution.
Pagnoni was arrested in April 2024 after law enforcement received a tip from a child exploitation sting.
He faces up to 20 years in prison for each charge, with sentencing scheduled for May 12.
